org.smartfrog.services.xunit.listeners.html
Class OneHostXMLListener

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.services.xunit.listeners.html.OneHostXMLListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, LogListener, TestListener, XmlListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
OneHostHtmlListener
public class OneHostXMLListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements XmlListener

This class listens to tests on a single host. The XML Listener forwards stuff to it. It is not a component; it is a utility class that components use, so as to log different test suites to different files.

Important: close the file after use. The finalizer does not clean up; it merely throws an assertion failure if it is called while the file is open.

transient cache of tests. We only really buffer during listening, but cache it in case wierd race conditions or multiple sources complicate our lives.

Constructor Detail

OneHostXMLListener

public OneHostXMLListener(java.lang.String hostname,
                          java.lang.String processname,
                          java.lang.String suitename,
                          java.io.File destFile,
                          java.util.Date startTime,
                          java.lang.String preamble)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Listen to stuff coming from a single host. opens the file for future messages

Parameters:
hostname - hostname of the (possibly remote system)
processname -
suitename - name of the test suite
destFile - destination file
startTime - timestamp (in UTC) of the start of the tests
preamble - any text to include before the root element, like PI and comments
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is trouble opening the file.
Method Detail

finalize

protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
all the cleanup routine does is assert that we were not still open. it does not close the file itself, because this should not be done in the finalizer.

Overrides:
